page.title: 06Industry
page.content: The two industrial areas in the region are at Tir-y-berth and the Penallta Industrial Estate. These have been developed to bring employment to the region where coal mining is being phased out. The Tir-y-berth industrial area has the Norgine factory which makes pharmaceutical products.The company employs eighty people.Most of the workers are local people,but the managers and scientists come from other areas.The head office is in Oxford.The firm has been in Tir-y-berth for sixteen years,since January 1969.The original product was produced in Prague in Czechoslovakia. The name Norgine is derived from the word Norway and the"gine"from algenic acid obtained from seaweed which was brought in sailing boats from Norway and then transported to Prague.
